case_vignette: A healthy 30-year-old man presents    with a 3-year history of an asymptomatic, fleshy papule at the base of his great toe. He denies any new lesions during this    time, a h   istory of trauma to the area, or a fa mily history of si   milar skin lesions. He was treated previ ously by another dermatologist with cryotherapy; however, he returns to the clinic with r   ecurrence of the lesion. Examination reveals a  pedunculated, flesh-colored, well-demarcated tumor on the plantar surface of the base of his great toe.
